newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo stocks end lower after cautious trade.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo stocks end lower after cautious trade.

text.p: Tokyo stocks ended a cautious session with losses on Monday as investors sat back to await an auction of land by a former state-owned railway firm after market hours, brokers said.
Attention was also being paid to movements in the currency market ahead of the Group of Seven (G7) meeting in Berlin this weekend, they said.
The 225-share Nikkei average shed 244.06 points or 1.33 percent to close at 18,085.95. Its March futures were down 200 points at 18,140.
"If the land fetches a higher price than expected, it could bolster the market, although only in the very near term," said Masaaki Higashida, a Nomura Securities Co Ltd strategist.
